intro: Bulbostylis densa subsp. afromontana, commonly known as the dense spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the montane regions of eastern Africa, including countries such as Kenya, Tanzania, and Uganda. This perennial herb is characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescence and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The plant plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small vertebrates.
